description.desc1: calibrate a real world projector inside SPARCK's 3D space

file.descript: select the transformation RIG. The file needs to be located inside the ~/_assets/_projectors folder. This file is usually created with the help this node and needs to be specifically saved once the calibration process is over.

edit.descript: sets the focus of the editor window to this node

RenderGroup.descript: set the render group to draw. Model/Canvas/MeshWarp/Grid have an equivalent in which you can choose which group to draw to.

show beamer icon.descript:
sets the display condition for the beamer icon on the 3DViewer: 
	<li>off - dont display
	<li>always 
	<li>editonly - display only if node has editor focus.

set texture dimensions.descript: sets the texture size of this render pass

colorscheme.descript:
sets the background color condition: 
	<li>custom - use custom color. 
	<li>nodecolor - (RIG color) 
	<li>nodecolor - only on edit

stereo.descript: creates two renderpasses for each stereo texture

for 3DViewer.descript:
set 3DViewer display condition for calibration-model: 
	<li>off 
	<li>always 
	<li>editonly - only when editor focus

for render.descript:
set render display condition for calibration-model: 
	<li>off 
	<li>always 
	<li>editonly - only when editor focus

Model.descript: Calibration model. Needs to be of type Wavefront OBJ.

Calibration.descript: The calibration settings. If you want to keep your calibration targets you need to save them here.

distance.descript: distance of projector from the origin target

polar.descript: polar angle. When used by the Calibrator - node, this setting can be modified with <alt>-mouse drag inside the editor window.

azimuth.descript: azimuth angle. When used by the Calibrator - node, this setting can be modified with <alt>-mouse drag inside the editor window.

width.descript: projection width at origin target. When used by the Calibrator - node, this setting can be modified with <ctrl>-mouse drag inside the editor window.

height.descript: projection height at origin target. When used by the Calibrator - node, this setting can be modified with <ctrl>-mouse drag inside the editor window.

Notes.note1: The most important shortcuts for the editor:
Notes.note2:
<li>s - save (if a filename has been specified before)
<li>h - toggle visibility of help
<li>tab - toggle [model] <-> [target] - mode 
<li><shift> tab - toggle [target] <-> [warp] - mode

Feedback.feedback1: Documentations take a lot of time and effort. Unfortunately both are scarce ressources.
Feedback.feedback2: If you would like to have more info about this node please drop a note. It helps to set priorities according to the user needs...
